Reviews.Title: I Like It, It Works For Me
Reviews.Author: VeeVee "VeeVee"
Reviews.Content: My old notebook crashed and I was in the need of a new laptop. However, I wanted a dual laptop/tablet and this Acer Aspire; thus far, has fit the bill

Reviews.Title: Wish I had never bought it
Reviews.Author: Diane K Ruchti
Reviews.Content: As in many other reviews I like the look and the key board is the best I have seen for a tablet.  I bought it for pleasure and also work travel because it is so light weight.  I loaded Office 2010 on the machine and it's almost unbearable to use.  It is unresponsive and balks all the time.  I am only using outlook most of the time.  You become so frustrated with it I just don't use it.  It is slow to respond, I never did get the wireless mouse to recognize so I just don't use it.  The table itself holds a 4 hour charge but the key board will not.  I think your better off with the Surface.

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing tablet!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Rayos
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing just the right tablet needed for my job! Highly recommended for students and professionals! It's handy and lightweight.

Reviews.Title: Acer Ultrabook
Reviews.Author: Alida Savana
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best laptop touch screen I have ever operated.  Easy to travel with as it is very light.  Keyboard life not to good you have to charge it regualarly.  Would have liked at least 2 USB's ports

Reviews.Title: Great tablet and laptop combination
Reviews.Author: P. King "Red Bow Girl"
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for students like myself. This ultrabook is lightweight and compact enough to fit into my backpack with lots of room to spare for all of my books and paper notebooks. Getting used to the new layout and operating system is the only thing I struggled with, but even that was short-lived. I would have given the ultrabook five stars but the product description said that it included Microsoft Office 2013; however it did not. I had to purchase the Microsoft Office 2013 software separately.

Reviews.Title: GREAT STUFF!
Reviews.Author: Selomit
Reviews.Content: I love it. Everything works so well, it even comes with a little bluetooth mouse. Windows 8 is a bit confusing in the beginning but once you get used to it it's pretty good. The device is awesome and it's not that difficult to detach from the case

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire P3-171-6820 11.6-Inch Convertible 2-in-1 Touchscreen Ultrabook...
Reviews.Author: MonJ
Reviews.Content: It took time for me to give my review for this product (Acer Aspire P3-171-6820 11.6-Inch Convertible 2-in-1 Touchscreen Ultrabook), coz I have to test drive and subject it to various test.My own verdict 4.5 STARS, I like this product, nothing beats it because of the price I have bought it against the specs and features...WOW!!! I refurbished more than the new-new ones, coz you can buy them half the price.I have encountered some obstacles along the test, but it is overcomeable......I have formatted it and installed Windows 8.1, it's not easy to install all of the components (trial and error). I can't upgrade into Windows 8 Pro, because the license is pre-loaded in BIOS. Before my re-installation, battery was draining overnight though its shutdown. For some reason after my re-installation battery works perfect now. Lastly, I wish that it was assembled with a better graphics card, something like with GPU, but I guess price will go up. I made some revision with the docking station that comes with it so that you can easily take it out and use it as tablet.At any point I like this product very much it has 3rd Gen i5, 120GB SSD, Convertible-Ultrabook. Great product. I did not hesitate taking it (though it's more than $500) because I have a previous Acer Tablet Iconia W500, until to this it is working great. I think it is safe to say that Acer have greatly improved to their design and quality.

Reviews.Title: good tablet
Reviews.Author: JOHN R MCGRAIL
Reviews.Content: The Tablet works well.  It could use another USB port.  The keyboard is difficult to attach and remove and it requires a cord that uses a usb port.  Other that that it works great.

Reviews.Title: Poor video performance for an ultrabook with i5 core
Reviews.Author: Nonno Giorgio
Reviews.Content: I choose this product because I wanted a  MSwindows convertible (tablet/PC) mainly to be able to watch HD videos on the go.After I upgraded to windows 8.1, all the HD (even low quality HD) videos appear jerky or blocked.

Reviews.Title: A Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Warren D
Reviews.Content: I find the Acer Aspire to be a seamless transition from my old laptop but having the advantages of modern technological innovations. I particularly like it's operating speed and light weight. I would have preferred better camera resolution though.
